description:
A secret life is the one thing they have in common. At school, Hori is a prim and perfect social butterfly, but the truth is she's a brash homebody. Meanwhile, under a gloomy facade, Miyamura hides a gentle heart, along with piercings and tattoos. In a chance meeting, they both reveal a side they've never shown. Could this blossom into something new?

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: โฮริมิยะ สาวมั่นกับนายมืดมน

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Masochism
tags.description: Prominently features characters who get sexual pleasure from being hurt or controlled by others.

tags.name: Sadism
tags.description: Prominently features characters deriving pleasure, especially sexual gratification, from inflicting pain, suffering, or humiliation on others.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/D_hagi) | [Website](http://gigina01.blog.fc2.com/)

In 2011, Daisuke Hagiwara created a oneshot titled Strong Chase Weak Animato (弱逃強追アニマート?) and was responsible for both the story and the art.

Beginning October 2011, Daisuke Hagiwara started collaborating with HERO on a spin-off of HERO's romcom Hori-san to Miyamura-kun webcomic, titled Horimiya. She worked as the artist, while HERO continued writing the story. The manga is serialized in the GFantasy magazine, published by Square Enix. Later on, Yen Press licensed the story in English.

Daisuke Hagiwara and HERO contributed to the Daily Lives of High School Boys Anthology (男子高校生の日常アンソロジー Danshi Kōkōsei no Nichijō Ansorojī?) alongside other various mangaka, which was released alongside Volume 6 of Yasunobu Yamauchi's Daily Lives of High School Boys.

In December 2012, Daisuke Hagiwara contributed to the Comic Anthology Kiwami: Horror, Suspense, Mystery (コミックアンソロジー 極　ホラー サスペンス ミステリー Komikku Ansorojī Kiwami Horā Sasupensu Misuterī) as one of the artists, notably for Back to the Jack (バック・トゥ・ザ・ジャック Bakku to~u za Jakku?). The manga ran for one volume and was serialized in Gangan ONLINE.

In 2013, she published a oneshot titled Dog and My Family Circumstance (狼イヌと私の家族事情 Inu to Watashi no Kazoku Jijō) and did both the story and artwork. The oneshot was serialized in Sylph.

She contributed to the Touken Ranbu -ONLINE- Anthology Comic: Touken Danshi Makuai Geki (刀剣乱舞 -ONLINE- アンソロジー コミック ～刀剣男士幕間劇～ Tōken Ranbu - ONLINE - Ansorojī Komikku ~ Tōken Otoko-shi Makuai Geki ~) in 2015 and the Touken Ranbu -ONLINE- Anthology Comic: Touken Danshi Shinpuu Roku (刀剣乱舞 -ONLINE- アンソロジー コミック ～刀剣男士幕間劇～ Tōken Ranbu - ONLINE - Ansorojī Komikku ~ Tōken Otoko-shi Shinpū Roku ~) in 2017, working as both an artist and writer. The anthologies were published by GFantasy and both covers were illustrated by them.

In 2017, Daisuke Hagiwara began working with writer Shizuku Totono as the illustrator of the romantic comedy NE NE NE (ねねね Ne ne ne), alternatively titled NEN NE NO NENE. The manga ran in Gangan Comics for one volume and was released in English by Yen Press in 2018.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/795583350)

Currently a freelancer with deep ties to [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

He is close friends with [Yasuomi Umetsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101583/).

Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)

Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/USUI_H)

Director of the Background Art Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

Wanted to pursue a career in anime after having seen [Princess Mononoke](https://anilist.co/anime/164/) while still in high school. The art depiction of the movie's setting made her want to become a background artist. She entered the industry in 2002, and joined Studio Who, a background art studio ran by [Tsutomu Fujita](https://anilist.co/staff/147331/). Later she joined Studio Easter and worked on many of [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/)' projects, most notably making her debut as an art director on [Idolmaster](https://anilist.co/anime/10278/). She has since served as an art director on [Your Lie in April](https://anilist.co/anime/20665/), [Occultic;Nine](https://anilist.co/anime/21708/), [Horimiya](https://anilist.co/anime/124080/) among others.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
Originating from Studio WHO. Currently affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/skm2y_1121)

Director of the Photography Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

After moving to Tokyo, Sakuma initially joined Azuhata Production, where he gained some experience before joining [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/) in 2009. There he took part in the production of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/), and later made his debut as director of photography on [Saint Onii-san](https://anilist.co/anime/15775/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yuki_Jouet) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yoh_kamiyama/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCw1U9K3S8WVWp7REGaHIW0A) | [SoundCloud](https://soundcloud.com/uki3) | [Website](https://yohkamiyama.com/) | [Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%A5%9E%E5%B1%B1%E7%BE%8A)

Yoh Kamiyama is a singer, lyricist, composer and arranger signed to Sony Music Associated Records.

__[Website](https://friends-jpn.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/FRIENDS_twtw) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/friendsbandtokyo)__

__Introduction:__
Friends is a Japanese five-piece band under record label Sony Music Associated Records (2019–), having previously been under Pimalaya Records (2017–2018) and Warner Music Japan (2018).

__Members:__
- Emi Okamoto (おかもとえみ) – music choreography, vocalist, lyricist and composer
- Hirose Hirose (ひろせひろせ) – vocalist, rapper, guitarist, lyricist and composer
- Ryouhei Nagashima (長島涼平, ながしまりょうへい) – leader, organizer and bassist
- Tarou Miura (三浦太郎, みうらたろう) – vocalist and guitarist
- Rui Sekiguchi (関口塁, せきぐちるい) – drummer

__Support Members:__
- Kenta Yamamoto (山本健太) – keyboardist
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

Hiroo Maruyama is a producer working for Mainichi Broadcasting System (MBS).

He joined Mainichi Broadcasting in 1999. Was transferred later to the Tokyo office and took over duties relating to the production of animation broadcasts. He was responsible for production on series like Gundam Seed, Gundam Seed Destiny and Full Metal Alchemist, all part of the 6:00pm Saturday timeblock, which gained wide popularity.
